intro: Mouriri viridicosta, commonly known as the green-stemmed mouriri, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Mouriri viridicosta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
